page.title: 08Litter in Alveston
page.content: Class 8 did a survey on conservation and litter.Every group of four children had a clip board and survey sheets for the five roads we studied they were Wolfridge Ride,Stoney Stile ,Greenhill Down,Down Road and Greenhill Down.On the survey sheets we had 3 categories: houses and gardens,roads and pavements and litter and a place for marks and comments.The marks ranged from 29 to 41 the highest one was Stoney Stile Road which scored the highest mark of 41 points. At school the amount of rubbish collected and disposed of is 1540 kilos per year.This 600 kg which is more than the weight of the boys and girls in class 8.Class 5 had the most rubbish 2kg 350 grammes in one day.
